#summary How to get started using GPS with gmapcatcher

= Introduction =

The current implementation displays a GPS marker and can auto center the map to the GPS location.

The GPS functionality is supported in linux only, using the gps daemon: http://gpsd.berlios.de .

If a GPS unit is properly installed and the gps daemon is running the GPS menu will show up in the main menu when gmapcatcher is started.

= Installation of python GPS module =

  * Ubuntu: _sudo apt-get install python-gps_

= Installation of bluetooth GPS =
  * Run _hcitool scan_ to find the GPS id on the form xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
  * Edit _/etc/bluetooth/rfcomm.conf_ and add the following:
{{{
rfcomm0 {
  bind yes; 
  device _xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx_; 
  channel 1; 
  comment "BT GPS"; 
}
}}}
  * Restart bluetooth: _sudo /etc/init.d/bluetooth restart_

= Using GPS module =
  * Start gps daemon: _sudo gpsd -D 5 -nN /dev/rfcomm0_
  * Start gmapcatcher: _python maps.py_
